lead_paragraph: Phil Mickelson mastered a strong wind to shoot a three-under-par 68 yesterday for a one-stroke lead over Gregory Havret after the third round of the Scottish Open in Luss.Mickelson had a 54-hole total of 12-under 201. Havret shot a 70.José Manuel Lara finished with a 74 to drop five strokes off the pace. Steve Webster shot a 69 and was third, three strokes back of Mickelson.Mickelson’s round included a walk into the water at the third hole after his second shot hit the green and spun back into a pond. He wore waterproof pants to hit his submerged ball out to 8 feet and holed the putt for a birdie.
